ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Tell me, how's your therapy session going?

I'll give my input as someone who had been passionate about the game for the longest time and still am to an extent. Please do not waste any money on the game if you're expecting an amazing experience because the content is barely even enough for how much it all costs. Overwatch 2 is not a sequel, it's mostly a cash shop overhaul and yeah it's been expressed a lot of times how Blizzard is scummy with their business practices but I'm recommending against the game because of the balancing. 

BLIZZARD SUCKS AT BALANCING THIS GAME HOLLLLIIEEEE

Greatest example I can give you is Mercy, a support character who I may all know from the SFM animations started out as a terrible support with an ult that made up for her lacking kit. She was so bad and considered a throw pick because she kept dying after mass rez. Blizzard rolled out a patch that made her INVINCIBLE when ulting which started a problem of people being unable to stop Mercy from ulting, many asked that they just make her ult a line of sight ability and giving her a cast time but after barely even trying to adjust her kit to boost her survivability they gave her a rework no one asked for. An ultimate ability was now a normal ability on cooldown that could be stacked and you could CHOOSE who to use it on, flying and team heal that allowed you to stay safe while dishing out crazy high sustain while reviving people who died it was insane. Mercy mains and actual players asked this be reverted, suggested BETTER and well balanced changes but nah Blizzard had to double down and till this day, YEARS after that rework are still nerfing her kit which has left her a frakenstien's monster of a hero with a kit that is detached from her identity as a hero. 

Don't even get me started on Symmetra, long story short, because Blizzard tried to focus this game into an esport the balance around it was so bad because the top players were mostly DPS mains and supports were not entertaining to watch. The game had boring METAs after DPS had to be nerfed once revives were scarce, then GOATs happened and so on. 

The game has this issue where at times matches just feel like a steamroll or so easy that they don't feel fun and now that Overwatch 2 came out having a single tank be in charge of applying pressure and controlling the field makes battles even more of a race to kill the other team's tank the fastest. Play the game by all means but it is not worth spending money over.

I usually don't just download a game just to leave a negative review, but what can I say? I wanted to join in on the fun of bashing on a shitty company like Blizzard. As someone who adored OW1 for a good chunk of time, seeing the awful state of OW2 just baffles me. Genuinely impressed how hard Blizzard fumbled, especially with the whole "guys, we are so sowwy but the scale and scope of the PvE mode just got too big, we cant deliver what we promised, please forgive us UwU".
crazy how they released overwatch 1 on steam
